CatDescriptText: Bernard Kopp, machinist, 15 Peter Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "No.  After all, I think that they are needed, as well as men, in order to have efficient armed forces."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bernard Kopp wearing light colored zippered jacket with striped knit collar, eyeglasses, and dark striped cap, standing on Liberty Avenue with Dimlings candy store in background, Downtown
